other_tests.findings: Identified a pulmonary arteriovenous malformation (PAVM) within the lingula.

Confirmed normal left ventricular and valvular function; prominent bubbles in the left heart chambers five beats after their first appearance in the right atrium, consistent with fast pulmonary transit time due to extracardiac shunting through the PAVM.
QP:QS shunt ratio of 9.5%; at room air, pH 7.41, pO2 83 mm Hg, pCO2 36 mm Hg; at FiO2 100%, pH 7.43, pO2 526 mm Hg, pCO2 36 mm Hg.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Post-procedure analysis showed no residual right-to-left shunt.

other_tests.findings: Confirmed the presence of a pulmonary arteriovenous fistula.
Showed a structurally normal heart and no evidence of an underlying infiltrative disorder.
